heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded was on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The heaviest rain was recorded on 02 September 2025 with a peak rate of 27.0mm per hour.  The storm lasted 15.0 hours and had a total rainfall of 21.19mm.

longest_rain.status: A relentless rainstorm took place on 04 January 2025, it lasted 37.2 hours and it delivered 36.8mm of rain at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 06 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is not a heatwaves right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 1.9.

tropical.status: The last tropical night was on 18 July 2025 and it has only happened 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average wind direction is southerly (178°), which differs from the average south-westerly (234.0°) by approximately 56.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The top recorded wind gust is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, a bit warmer for the feels like temperature (up 3.6°C) and outside temperature (up 2.4°C) and more moisture-laden outside humidity (up 8%) and rainfall (up 0.1 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 796 m) and light levels (up 6601 lux).

The past week and month had observable variation in rainfall (up 0.3 mm), cloud levels (up 930 m), and light levels (up 5527 lux) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 796.1m lower than yesterday, 106.8m lower than the past week, 929.9m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 737m to 4780m and averaged 1597.6m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: Clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; like a nice, warm day. Also, the air will feel noticeably humid and uncomfortable and little or no wind. Possible light showers, clouds will be high, allowing good sunlight, and some sunny spells will occur. Weather could become unsettled.
